revised_title: In Memoriam: Celebrating the Lives and Contributions of Distinguished Scientists
tldr: This address by Sir Ernest Rutherford commemorates the lives and significant contributions of sixteen Fellows and one Foreign Member of the Royal Society who passed away during the year. The deceased members include prominent figures in various scientific disciplines such as physics, biology, geology, and medicine. Their achievements and legacies are celebrated and remembered in this tribute.
scientific_discipline: Social Sciences, Art, and Humanities > Biographies and Book Reviews
